page.title: 08ORMSKIRK PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The church of St Peter and St Paul is Ormskirk's most famous historic building. The Name "Ormskirk" suggests Scandinavian origin and the church is one of only four in the country to have both a tower and a steeple. The steeple was built in 1430 much earlier than the tower which was needed to house the bells of Burscough Priory following the dissolution of the monastries. The church is in the Diocese of Liverpool and employs a full time vicar and a curate. It has many uniformed groups such as scouts and guides and other organisations such as toddler groups and a youth club. Once a month, all the uniformed groups parade to show the church at work. Ormskirk C. of E. primary School is connecvted with the church holding Christmas and Easter services there.
